definition: to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa

sentences.english: The teacher has won the love and esteem of his (or her) students.
sentences.chinese: 這位老師關心同學，嚴以律己，深受學生們的愛戴。

sentences.english: Be strict with yourself and lenient toward others.
In all honesty, o man, don't stop the advance of others.
sentences.chinese: 誠以待人，嚴以律己，自求奮進，勿損他人。

sentences.english: We can perfect our character by disciplining ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 嚴以律己可以讓我們更好的完善自己的性格。
